captions.text:
[ Adams ]
May l come in ?

lf you bend your medial
collateral ligaments...

and place one talus
in front of another...

l don't see where
you'd have a problem.

Of course, if there were a news story
covering this event...

the headline might read:
''Small Brain Enters Room.''

The fingers.
What's the answer ?

Oh, you're another one of
those bright young fellows...

who always know the right answer,
is that it ?
Welcome to real life.
How many do you see ?

- There are four fingers, Arthur.
- No, no, no. Look at me.
What ?

Y-You're focusing
on the problem.

lf you focus on the problem,
you can't see the solution.

Never focus on the problem.
Look at me !
How many do you see ?
No, look beyond the fingers.
How many do you see ?
Eight.

Eight. Eight.
Yes ! Yes !

Eight's a good answer.
Yes.
See what no one else sees.

See what everyone else
chooses not to see...

out of fear
and conformity and laziness.

See the whole world anew
each day.

Ah, the truth is,
you're well on the way.

lf you didn't
see something here...

besides a crazy,
bitter old man...

you wouldn't have come
in the first place.

What do you see
when you look at me, Arthur ?
You fixed my cup.
l'll see you around...
Patch.
[ Squeaking ]

comments.text:
*Robin Williams -* *Patch Adams*
*"See what no one else sees. See what everyone chooses not to see... out of 
fear, conformity or laziness. See the whole world anew each day!"*

*"I love you without knowing how, or when, or from where. I love you 
straightforwardly without complexities or pride. I love you because I know 
no other way then this. So close that your hand, on my chest, is my hand. 
So close, that when you close your eyes, I fall asleep."*﻿

comments.author: Michele Suess

comments.text:
May Zak, Zelda, and Codey find peace in their hearts and wholly accept that 
enormous legacy that their father has left in their hands... Robin made a 
truly indelible mark on this modern society. I will miss him and I send my 
condolences to his kids and the rest of the Williams family. May Robin 
attain a fortunate human rebirth, one that is imbued with so much joy, 
spiritual practice and deep development of inner-strength, and artistic 
creativity, once again touching the lives of hundreds of millions around 
the world. #RobinWilliams was fabulous troubadour and a genius of an actor.﻿

comments.author: bill bixby

comments.text:
Patch Adams was a rationalist, an overthinker of things , worring about 
everything , trying to solve every problem by pure logic I guess , and he 
is depressive, because that is what reasoning does to the brain ... and he 
meets this other guy who is at the other end of the spectrum . He uses 
imagination to get answers to his problem . He focuses on the solution . 
Imagination is not your Iq .. it is your Eq . So this old guy was psychotic 
because , I guess he abused it ... but a very smart individual indeed . And 
he teaches Patch Adams to do the same thing ... to focus on the solution 
not the problem . If you think about it ... it's the Law of Attraction at 
work here . The old guy even mentions something ... that Patch Adams is 
about to change just because he came to him . Hope it helped you buddy !!

comments.text:
Truth is, those who feel that this holds no water are misguided. It just

comments.author: LouieOrama

comments.text:
Geez ppl, I don't think his words were meant to be taken so seriously as to 
apply them to life and all problems big or small, personal or worldly. It 
was just a great set-up to the MOVIE.... and sure, something to ponder from 
time to time in those instances where we do have to look beyond the problem 
for a solution. But I don't think anyone ever claimed this the end all be 
all to life's problems everywhere.
comments.author: 2BAlive100

comments.text:
Did you even watch this movie? Of course what he says doesn't apply to ever 
single problem out there, but it's the set up for the whole god damn movie 
genius. Patch Adams choose not to focus on 'the problem' I.e., the disease, 
but rather looked beyond the disease and saw the person. He did what most 
other people didn't do and thereby was able to reach people on a more 
powerful level than medicine.
comments.author: 2BAlive100

comments.text: so true...
comments.author: Miroslav Pavlovic

comments.text:
It is simple buddy I think, we get stressed out by many many problems each 
day . If we focus on the problems .. we get overwhelmed and depressed . If 
you've watched this movie ... you will see that Patch gets out of here 
without being depressed anymore . When he confronted one of his teachers 
... he started to look unfocused at his teacher arguing with him and that 
made him relaxed . When you read text for example you can read it with 
focus or you can read it also by creating images.
comments.author: don77frye

comments.text: That was touching
comments.author: Andrew Dubowitz

comments.text:
I think some of you focused on the problem :D...I think this line from the 
clip will make more sense "See what no one else sees, see what everyone 
chooses not to see, out of fear, confirmity or laziness. See the whole 
world anew each day." than "if you focus on the problem, you won't find the 
solution". Look beyond :D
comments.author: Yagee Dreys

comments.text:
From a mathematics point of view this makes sense. Sometimes to find a 
solution you need to explore other methodologies. Too many people seemed to 
have over-analyzed this line. Not focusing on the problem doesn't mean 
ignoring it all together (that's stupid), just simply not rely on the 
cookie-cut method all the time. That's my interpretation at least.
comments.author: Nicolas Mercado

comments.text:
You really dont see it, do you? If you focus on problems, you never see the 
solution. Which means; see what you want, then work for, without focusing 
why you dont have it in the first place.

So if you focus on the problem you get four fingers, but if you focus on

solution, you have twice the problem.
